arm_group.description: Critical care patients with respiratory failure who were mechanically ventilated and who underwent tracheostomy
Critical care patients with respiratory failure who were mechanically ventilated but did not undergo tracheostomy

brief_summary.textblock:
To determine the morbidity and mortality of patients who have undergone percutaneous
      tracheostomy due to respiratory failure in the critical care unit and after intensive care
      in the internal medicine department, including follow-up of quality of life of these
      patients.

clinical_study.brief_title: Outcome Evaluation of Patients After Percutaneous Tracheostomy Due to Respiratory Failure in an Intensive Care Unit

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Mechanically ventilated critical care patients

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  All others

study_pop.textblock:
Patients with respiratory failure who were mechanically ventilated in the critical care
        unit

primary_outcome.description: Retrospective review of charts showing increase in morbidity in patients with respiratory failure with tracheostomy taking place 2 weeks after admission to critical care
primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with tracheostomy due to respiratory failure who died

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Retrospective
